TopicTitle: Gameplay questions that don't merit their own topic.

Articles.Content:
I'll start:

Flying the first plane I built - which looks like ones I've flown in KSP... the wings were all flappy.  Literally every time I hit the W or S key, the wings would flap like they were duck taped or connected by rubber.

Is that a design error, a 'need to add struts' thing - or possibly a problem with how KSP2 is currently handling the physics and part interactions?

One thing that I found helped was decreasing the size of the control surface - if it's too big proportional to the craft, it does tend to cause a lot of flop! So ah, I forget which exact parameter that is, but try making it take up less space "into" the wing.

Anyone know how to keep the plane from bouncing every time I land?

I've been trying spring strength and damper controls but haven't gotten the hang of it.

Moved to game play questions, which due to the nature of the sub, will mangle the format of this thread.     Probably best to ask each question in own thread to create a searchable index in the forums.
